messages.messageBody:
Here is a more direct link:
http://www.registerguard.com/news/2004/04/04/a1.unschooling.0404.html

April 4, 2004
'Unschool' lessons: Children decide what they want homeschooling
By Anne Williams The Register-Guard

----- Original Message ----- > I just checked my email today (Monday) and
the Sunday paper is no longer on their website,

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] front page article about unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/6/04 06:56:11 AM Central Daylight Time, Mattamandab@aol.com writes: I would love to read this article! I just checked my email today
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/6/04 06:56:11 AM Central Daylight Time,
Mattamandab@... writes:
I would love to read this article!
I just checked my email today (Monday) and the Sunday paper is no longer on
Their website, the Monday front page is. Could someone who forwarded the
article to their relatives please send it on to me? (Unless you just sent
them
the link to the paper)
##########

You can click on a link off to the side to read past days pages. There is a
box with all the days listed, just click on Sunday.
~Nancy

messages.subject: front page article about unschooling

messages.messageBody:
I would love to read this article!
I just checked my email today (Monday) and the Sunday paper is no longer on
their website, the Monday front page is. Could someone who forwarded the
article to their relatives please send it on to me? (Unless you just sent them
the link to the paper)

Or is there something I'm missing and I can still read the article even
though it's today's paper they have up now?

Thanks for the help!!!

Amanda
